thread.title: Hampshire X-Factor star launches solo career after band splits
thread.title_full: Hampshire X-Factor star launches solo career after band splits

title: Hampshire X-Factor star launches solo career after band splits
text:
0 comments 
JUST a few months ago Hampshire's Tom Mann was heading for the top of the charts with his boyband Stereo Kicks. 
But after a whirlwind year of touring and TV fame through ITV talent show the X-Factor, the band has split after they failed to secure a record deal. 
Their management financed their one single release,Love Me So, which was written by Tom who hails from Chandlers Ford which proved a success, hitting Number 3 on the midweek UK singles chart and No 1 for physical record sales. 
Now Tom, 21, has launched a solo career and is busy writing, recording and doing a mini tour. 
He is performing at The Joiners in Southampton this Thursday October 29 which looks likely to sell out fast! 
Meanwhile this year's X Factor hopefuls will be keen to make the final and secure a place on the X Factor Live tour, playing major venues like the Bournemouth International Centre just like Tom and Stereo Kicks did. 
The X Factor 2016 Live Tour is a country wide arena tour which will travel to the BIC on February 24 and 25. Contestants will be performing classic songs and viewersâ€™ favourites from the TV series. 
Attended by over three million people, The X Factor Live Tour has been one of the most successful annual arena tours in the UK for the past eleven years. Share article 
Catch this year's stars live.
